topics.body:
You know how ISIS is a common topic in the news and their atrocities are obviously depressing to talk about?
I'd like to discuss something on the opposite side of the spectrum...
I want you all to look at this image here.
!http://ichef.bbci.co.uk/news/660/media/images/81714000/png/_81714495_archangel7.png!
This man is known as "The Archangel of Death" and he's currently fighting ISIS. And only a man like him who has been fighting in this kind of warfare for years should be granted a name as _fucking *metal*_ as that.

He wields;
An axe
A sub-machine gun
and a fucking *sword*.

No doubt he keeps these weapons stored in that beard of his. And that's not a joke, he really weilds these weapons on the battlefield.
!http://ichef.bbci.co.uk/news/624/media/images/81716000/png/_81716392_archangel1.png!
!http://ichef.bbci.co.uk/news/304/media/images/81700000/png/_81700663_archangel2.png!

topics.body: You know, I got to thinking, why do some people think "Cunt" is such an offensive word?
topics.author: 515ddf93a4c72d8a1f000d57

topics.body:
"@ParagonCommander":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/553d5f226368724951c81300#post_553d5f226368724951c81300

topics.body:
"@ParagonCommander":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/553d5f226368724951c81300#post_553d5f226368724951c81300
Cause the word hasn't been destigmatized yet.

Think about it as like the word "slut"; the word hasn't been fully destigmatized yet and sure there are some people who like being called that, but it's going to take years until it's just another word.

South Park hit the nail on the head with one of their episodes; after a couple decades insults lose their edge after being over used and eventually they become just another word.  To use a analogy it's like the word "nigger"; that word has almost been completely destigmatized and in a decade or two I wouldn't be surprised if it becomes just another english word.

Basically what I mean by this is that I wouldn't be surprised if say in 2 decades "nigger" becomes just a synonym for "buddy"; like instead of saying "what's up" people use it as a greeting instead to symbolize someone is a friend.  I wouldn't be surprised if "slut" just replaces the word "sexy".  The problem with the word "cunt" is that it doesn't have a destigmatized meaning yet.

The best way to get rid of swear words is to redefine them and destigmatize them.  So long as people think of a word as bad it increases the stigmatization of being called it.  The last thing that people who legitimately use the words as insults want is for the stigmatization to be destroyed.  So long as people are afraid of being called those words the people who use them as insults have power.  If the words are no longer feared they no longer have any power.
